Display.wideColumnPages: Outage List;Active Service Alarms;Offline Window;Violation Configuration;History

Information.Text: The service name
Information.Subtext: The name of the service managed by this SLA.

Information.Text: Compliance status
Information.Subtext:
This represents the compliance status of your SLA according to the specified objectives. These objectives are: - The allowed total violation - The allowed single violation - The allowed number of violations
The compliance status can be: - Compliant: Your SLA is 100% compliant. - Breached: Your SLA is breached. - Compliant (Degraded): Your SLA is compliant, but has degraded. - Compliant (Degrading): Your SLA is compliant, but is currently degrading.

Information.Text: The service alarm state
Information.Subtext: This is the alarm state of the service managed by this SLA.

Information.Text: Predicted compliance status
Information.Subtext:
This represents the predicted compliance status of your SLA according to the specified objectives, and presumes a linear trend in the violations. The objectives are: - The allowed total violation - The allowed number of violations
The base timeslot for the predictions is: For a fixed window, from the beginning of the window up until now. For a sliding window, from the beginning of the first alarm in the current window up until now. The predicted compliance is then extrapolated from this timeslot and the violations in it.
The compliance status can be: - Compliant: Your SLA is 100% compliant. - Breached: Your SLA is breached. - Jeopardy: If your service keeps failing at the current ratio, your SLA will by breached by the end of the window.

Information.Text: Total violation time left
Information.Subtext: This indicates how long the SLA can still be violated before it is breached. A value of 0s indicates that your SLA is breached.

Information.Text: Total Violation Time
Information.Subtext: This indicates how long the SLA has currently been violated.
Longest Violation Time
Information.Text: This indicates the duration of the longest violation.
Number of Violations
Information.Subtext: This represents the number of violations that occurred in the current window.
Last Manual Reset
Information.Text: Indicates when the last manual reset of the SLA was done.
Time base when using a fixed window.
Information.Subtext:
This parameter is only useful when using a fixed window. It allows you to specify when the window has to start.
The default value is 2001/01/01 00:00:00. When this default value is used, a year will start on the first of January at midnight, a month will start on the first of each month, a week will start on Mondays, a day will start on midnight, and an hour wil start at 0 minutes.
Some samples: If you want weeks to start on Sunday, specify '2006/01/01 00:00:00' If you want months to start on the 15th, specify '2006/01/15 00:00:00'
Start Time
Information.Text: This is the start time of the current monitor window.

Information.Subtext: End Time
Information.Text: This is the end time of the current monitor window.
The percent of time the SLA is violated.
Information.Subtext: This indicates the percentage of time the SLA is violated. This is a percentage of the total monitor period.

Information.Text: Admin state
Information.Subtext:
Indicates whether the SLA is currently tracking or not. Violations that occur while the state is not tracking have no impact on the SLA.
This can be useful in combination with sSheduler, if your SLA is only tracking e.g. during business hours, or if you are doing some maintenance on the system. This will keep your SLA-report clean when violations occur at irrelevant times.

Information.Text: The maximum consecutive time left before the SLA is breached.
Information.Subtext: This indicates how long the SLA can still be violated consecutively until it is breached. A value of 0s indicates that your SLA is breached.

Information.Text: Total violation time availability
Information.Subtext: This indicates how many of the allowed violation time are available. A value of 0% indicates that your SLA is breached.

Information.Text: Single violation time availability
Information.Subtext: This indicates how much of the allowed single violation time is available. A value of 0% indicates that your SLA is breached. When this objective is not breached, and there is currently no violation, a value of 100% is indicated.

Information.Text: Number of violations left
Information.Subtext: This indicates how many violations can still occur before the SLA is breached.

Information.Text: Number of violations availability
Information.Subtext: This indicates how many of the allowed number of violations are available. A value of 0% indicates that your SLA is breached.

Information.Text: Availability of the service.
Information.Subtext: This indicates the service availability percentage during the current window, and at the current moment.

Information.Text: Predicted availability of your service.
Information.Subtext:
This indicates the predicted availability of your service at the end of the window, and presumes a linear trend in the violations.
The base timeslot for the predictions is: for a fixed window, from the beginning of the window up until now. for a sliding window, from the beginning of the first alarm in the current window up until now.
The predicted availability is then extrapolated from this timeslot and from the current total violation time.
Time to Keep Outages
Information.Text: Specifies how long to keep outages when they are no longer in the current window.
Availability of the service, without correction.
Information.Subtext: This indicates the service availability percentage during the current window, and at the current moment. Corrections on outages are ignored.
SLA Validity Start Time
Information.Text: This is the start time of when the service is active.

Information.Subtext: SLA Validity End Time
Information.Text: This is the end time of when the service is active.
This is the start time of when the SLA is active. Format (YYYY/MM/DD HH:MM:SS)
This is the end time of when the SLA is active. Format (YYYY/MM/DD HH:MM:SS)
The service alarm state
Information.Subtext: This is the alarm state of the service managed by this SLA.

Information.Text: Service live state
Information.Subtext: Indicates whether the service is currently on air or not.

Information.Text: Current outage impact
Information.Subtext: Shows the impact of the current alarms on the SLA.

Information.Text: Outage violation impact
Information.Subtext: Shows how much the outage is impacted with the current alarms.
Total Outage Time
Information.Text: This indicates how long the SLA is currently affected.

Information.Subtext: Longest Outage Time
Information.Text: This indicates the longest outage time.

Information.Subtext: Time
Information.Text: Specifies the windowsize of the SLA.
The SLA Time.
Information.Subtext: The time of the SLA.
Unit
Information.Text: Specifies the windowsize of the SLA.
The SLA Unit.
Information.Subtext: The unit of the SLA.

Information.Text: The windowtype of the SLA.
Information.Subtext:
The windowtype of the SLA.
Sliding window: The violations will gradually disappear. Fixed window: The violations will be removed at the beginning of a new slot.
Delay Time
Information.Text: This specifies how long an outage may occur, before it becomes a violation.

Information.Subtext: Minimum Outage Threshold
Information.Text: Period of the outage, if the delay time has passed, that doesn't count as violation time.

Information.Subtext: Maximum Total Violations Value
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum total allowed violation time value.

Information.Subtext: Maximum Total Violations Unit
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum total allowed violation time unit.

Information.Subtext: Maximum Single Violation Value
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum single allowed violation time value.

Information.Subtext: Maximum Single Violation Unit
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum single allowed violation time unit.

Information.Subtext: Total Violations Before Breach
Information.Text: Compliance: The maximum allowed number of violations.

Information.Subtext: Violation Level
Information.Text: This indicates from which alarm level onwards the SLA is violated.
The start time of the manual outage to be added.
Information.Subtext: This time should be formatted as YYYY/MM/DD hh:mm:ss

Information.Text: The start time of the manual outage to be added.
Information.Subtext: This time should be formatted as YYYY/MM/DD hh:mm:ss

Information.Text: The end time of the manual outage to be added.
Information.Subtext: This time should be formatted as YYYY/MM/DD hh:mm:ss

Information.Text: The end time of the manual outage to be added.
Information.Subtext: This time should be formatted as YYYY/MM/DD hh:mm:ss

Information.Text: The motivation of the manual outage to be added.
The motivation of the manual outage to be added.
This indicates if motivations on overruled outages should be overwritten with a reference to the current outage.
This indicates if motivations on overruled outages should be overwritten with a reference to the current outage.

Information.Subtext: Adds the outage defined in parameters 133,135 and 137. Parameters 147 and 149 are used to make the entered datetimes in the local format rather than the internal fixed format.

Information.Text: Deletes a manual outage.

Information.Subtext: The primary key(s) of the outage to be deleted. Semicolon-separated values.
The start time of the manual outage to be added.
The end time of the manual outage to be added.
Maximum Total Violation Time
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum total violation time

Information.Subtext: Maximum Single Violation Time
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum single violation time
Compliance: Maximum total violation type
Information.Subtext:
Specifies how the maximum total violation time is configured.
- Relative: Specify a percentage of the monitor window. - Absolute: Specify a fixed time in seconds, minutes, hours or days. - Not used: The maximum total violation time is not used.

Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum single violation type
Information.Subtext:
Specifies how you configure the maximum single violation time.
- Relative: You will have to specify a percentage of the monitor window. - Absolute: You specify a fixed time in seconds, minutes, hours or days. - Not used: You do not use the maximum single violation time.
Maximum Total Violations Percentage
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum total violation percentage

Information.Subtext: Maximum Single Violation Percentage
Information.Text: Compliance: Maximum single violation percentage

Information.Subtext: Outage to Stop or Delete

Information.Text: Hide violation filtered alarms
Information.Subtext:
Indicates whether the SLA has to show outages that have no impact on it. When an alarm does not meet the expectations of the set filters: If this parameter is set to show, an outage with 0% violation is generated. If this parameter is set to hide, 0% outages will no longer be generated.
This can be useful when you only want to see outages that affect the SLA. E.g. if warnings have no effect on the SLA, you might want to hide these alarms. This will keep your SLA report clean when warnings occur often.
